author: al.kc
title: Scale-up Africa’s Community Hubs
description: Community hubs in Africa are often seen as charitable causes as the value they deliver can be hard to quantify, and they may lack expertise in delivering focused commercial growth

author: henokp50
title: Cryptocurrency Exchange
description: Buying ADA in most African countries is challenging due to the lack of exchange that supports trading in fiat currency.

author: wada
title: CatalystCon 22 - Africa Spotlight
description: Africa exists at the heart of Cardano's global adoption strategy, yet there is lack of visibility of the African success stories to come out of Catalyst since its inception.

author: defi.babylon
title: JUS: Decentralized Onramp + Credit
description: In countries with high inflation, many are still economically marginalised, undocumented and unable to access banking systems- let alone Web 3.0

author: shirah
title: TV Series ft. Cardano: awo.AI
description: There's a lack of compelling and entertaining media projects to educate African audiences about Web3, Cardano and Project Catalyst.

author: ddlezu01
title: Sub-Sahara Africa (Cardano Mission)
description: The Cardano mission continues as initiatives in Africa to gain momentum, however, policy makers and market shareholders have not yet identify the potentials of Cardano Blockchain Technology.

author: uptodatedevelopers
title: CARDANO FRENCH COMMUNITY IN DRC
description: Projects developed in French-speaking African countries lack information on blockchain technology in general.

author: afia
title: Catalyst Africa Town Hall (CATH)
description: Participating in Catalyst is difficult and quite challenging when you live in the Africa where English is not the main language for most descents.

author: afia
title: The Africa Catalyst School
description: Africa is not actively engaged in Cardano programs/activities of the Catalyst School. Africa oriented platform will drive up participation.

author: emeliasarfo2
title: Ghana Youth Onboarding Outreach 2
description: Most of the productive youth in Ghana are not aware of blockchain technology and its opportunities. Cardano project catalyst education can bring adoption and scale up through their wild ideas.

author: captivatingnaturals
title: Cardano Africa SmartFarming DApp
description: Lack of efficiency in coffee farming. Africa's potential Coffee production is not being met. We have a bounty of raw materials but production output is low. Miscommunication farmer owners/managers

author: manfo2021
title: SSI from ancestral African Lenses
description: The notion of Identity is deeply ingrained in the initiatory journey of ancestral Africa communities. No solutions out there come close to incorporating the African perspective on this notion.

author: djmermoz
title: Katiopa NFArt - NFCraft Marketplace
description:
Africa is late in leveraging opportunities offered by NFTs to implement strategies to address some of its deepest unresolved issues facing the continent in 3 main areas

Culture
History
Gaming

author: djmermoz
title: KodiaCoin: Mbongo=>Nzimbu paradigm
description: Most tokens use production and distribution models based on the scarcity paradigm typical of the Western context. Deep ancestral Africa has an alternative!

author: nanasafo01
title: Growing The African Tertiary Sector
description: The Cardano ecosystem and Project Catalyst are gradually evolving in Africa. However, the adoption rate in the African tertiary sector is very minimal and thus needs to be uplifted, but how?

author: cole.vt
title: Onboarding Pikes Malawi Community
description: Community leaders like Pike, an environmental warrior from Malawi, can be funded through the Cardano ecosystem but knowledge barriers prevent them from using blockchains and Cardano.

author: karofiguy
title: Catalyst Resources in WaZoBia
description: More than half of Nigeria's 200million people are connected to the internet. However, 70% of the entire population is living in abject poverty. The internet can be a tool to lift them out of poverty.

author: mohamed.mahmoud.lsnet
title: KemiLand MVP - The Royal Palace
description: Ancient Civilizations sightseeing requires a budget for travel, accommodation, etc and time travel is not yet invented.😁

author: theartbanker
title: Cardano Community Center Cape Town
description: South Africa has no real-world education and training venues bringing South Africans together to learn and develop with Cardano, yet South Africa is the 3rd largest economy in Africa.

author: paulmb
title: ISIG-GOMA Cardano Hub
description:
Students in Africa and especially those in the DRC (French speaking) are lagging
behind in the development of Blockchain and its usefulness.

author: thiago.ouros
title: Business Strategy for African Proj.
description: African community projects need more guidance to match the goals of growing Cardano in Africa and they will have a hard time finding time from experienced community members to leverage their projects.

author: tylercase
title: Regenerate Yem (Ethiopia)
description: In Ethiopian highlands, population explosion and mis/over-use of the ecosystem have caused acute resource and food insecurity leading to conflicts and threatening widespread famine.

author: babaelliot
title: Cardano Hub In East Africa
description: Low active engagement and contribution from Eastern Africa region in Catalyst and Cardano ecosystem. To mention a few reasons could be language barrier and difference in timezone for online meetups.

author: shirogat
title: Cardano needs Math Teachers
description: Object oriented programming is commonly used in normal programming

author: ebutech
title: Hackathon and Internship Program
description: Over 90% of African businesses are SMEs and cannot afford traditional business protection through a lawyer. This factor puts them at risk of losses in case of contract breaches and non-commitment.

author: fatousowmali
title: EDUCATE SENEGAL INNOVATORS - DI/FI
description: Young Senegalese regenerative innovators need to learn about intellectual property and digital and financial identity-building, towards using a new monetisation model linking ADA with Financial Tech.

author: raz
title: HIre ArtSuite Coordinator in Africa
description: Artists in Africa have little exposure globally. Web 3.0, NFT and digital economy livelihoods aren’t easily accessible nor comprehended.

author: toshimasa.yagi
title: Sustainable Coffee to Earn 🌍☕️✍️
description: By 2050, global coffee production will be halved. It is due to the decline in cultivated areas due to global warming and the inadequate monetization of producers in Africa. This is not sustainable.

author: eagle
title: Translate Pool Peek Mobile: Swahili
description: It is not straight forward for non-English speaking users to onboard into the Cardano ecosystem.

author: kmuhindi
title: Buy Ada with M-PESA
description: A large number of Kenyans have heard about crypto but, currently there is no easy way for new users to get started with buying crypto. Most options are global exchanges with difficult KYC processes.

author: lidonation
title: Swahili Learn to Earn
description: Vast numbers of native Swahili-speakers in Africa will not learn about Cardano or use Blockchain tools unless there is engaging educational content in a familiar language & clear incentives to learn.

author: wada
title: Nurturing Roots in Africa
description: Wada hubs are off to a great start, but are not yet able to fully self sustain themselves. The next level of support is needed to continue their 3 year path to financial independence.

author: emile.schoemaker
title: Empowering African Farmers with NFT
description:
Cashew and other Farmers financial hardship in Africa. Crops are often transported to neighbour countries before exported to Europe/USA. 
often Consumers are mis-informed where products come from.

author: ihelper
title: North Africa Cardano Community Hub
description: Most North Africans (Morocco, Algeria, Mauritania, Tunisia, Libya, Egypt, Sudan) native language is Arabic, many speak french but most Cardano materials are in English.

author: emile.schoemaker
title: EcoCashew.com & partnerships
description: People & potential partners are not aware of the EcoCashew ECO Fair Trade Project in West Africa. A sustainable cashew project that aims to bring Cashew Processing to the Cashew Farmers.

author: zakariam.munir
title: Cardano and Agri Value Chain
description: African Agriculture is late regarding blockchain technology information and payment system integration, especially in the Ghanaian Agricultural world.

author: madfolio
title: Enabling microgrid transactions
description: We must utilise 100% of renewable energy made. Micro-production of electricity will become very important. Africa has huge potential for micro-solar but not the grid infrastructure: creating waste.

author: wada
title: Wada Internships->African Students
description:
A growing number of Catalyst projects require support, but may not have the funding or requirements for a full-time hire.

There is a pool of talent that is currently underserved and underutilized.

author: redtaged1
title: MCA: A Model School in SA - Part II
description: Utilization and adoption of the Cardano protocol is extremely challenging for faculty and students in SA with limited computer experience and inadequate internet connectivity.

author: henrik.metsamaki
title: Employment Credentials in Tanzania
description: Zanzibar and the wider Tanzania is becoming one of the hotspots for blockchain implementation through IOG and World Mobile, but this potential of people with DID's is only barely exploited

author: bradleymheather
title: The Story Bank
description: Indigenious wisdom is being lost at an alarming rate in both Africa and further afield. Local communities lack the access to the technology that could help preserve their stories.

author: quintin
title: Onboarding African Musicians to ADA
description: There is no easy path for Musicians in Africa to be onboarded to Cardano with Web 3.0.

author: natdwamena
title: Ubuntu Informal Biz Credit DApp
description: Lack of access to financial credit is deepening the woes of informal businesses in Africa due to a lack of collateral. How can we provide credit to businesses in the informal sector?

author: faakor
title: Seniors Ideate
description: New technology is usually targeted at the youth. Seniors are left out although they have the brainpower and free time to ideate and develop projects to improve the communities they live in

author: cardano4climate
title: Cardano4Climate Africa
description: While climate change is probably the biggest risk for Africa today there is no community platform focused to support Africa related initiatives promoting climate resilience into everyday activities

author: humanbeing
title: Boosting Cardano In South Africa
description: The evolution of the Cardano ecosystem and the project catalyst in the African region is moderate but is barely adopted in South Africa. Thus, it requires boosting.

author: adaku
title: CARDANO'S FIRST CONCERT IN AFRICA!
description: Blockchain/Web3 can be confusing to the average person so this is a barrier, but there are huge benefits for the youth in African to get involved with Project Catalyst/Cardano ecosystem. How? Music.

author: angelanartey00
title: Inspiring Ladies Colloquim
description: Most young female youth are not aware of the Cardano blockchain technology and its opportunity in Africa.

author: hakua1993
title: Africa Short Films with Cardano
description: How do we inspire the average person to align themselves with Cardano's mission while bringing clarity to what Cardano is doing in Africa.

author: makdavid92
title: Gateway of blockchain-Learn to earn
description: Students are mostly motivated by incentivized Learning system. Therefore, how do we provide a learn to earn platform that would help onboard them into the Cardano ecosystem.

author: jerrybnj
title: Blockchain Education Masterclass
description: Education is key to adoption and use of a service. How can we educate students in Northern Ghana and beyond about Cardano Ecosystem and its benefits?

author: nzola8
title: Lokole to Grow Africa Grow Cardano
description: It is very difficult to grow Africa grow Cardano efficiently because less than 43% of the African population is connected to the internet and the majority of the people do not have electricity.

author: cerpofficial
title: Cardano ERP - Grow Africa
description: Cardano needs more developers from Africa participating in Emurgo Academy training and developing enterprise-grade products on the Cardano blockchain.

author: oswald
title: Crypto and blockchain adoption
description: For Africa, cryptos and the blcockchain represent a great financial opportunity. But users lack tools to buy, sell, exchange, learn, build... Tools adapted to our realities for easy,healthy adoption.

author: wims
title: WIMS Cardano Girls Education
description: Girl education in Africa is very low due to poverty, cultural gender preferences, religious beliefs and due to lack of resources. Cardano lacks firm roots in Africa and worse lacks utility value.

author: paulmcolaka
title: AFRICA BLOCKCHAIN YOUTH AMBASSADORS
description: Development, deployment and adoption of blockchain in Africa continue to encounter challenges such as inadequate skillset, negative public perception, varying level of blockchain literacy.

author: benzvibenjamin
title: Caricatures 4 Africa
description: There is not enough creative and amusing ways to promote Cardano and Catalyst to the African community

author: kidus
title: WeCare: Unlocking Human Finance
description: The global non profit industry has brought millions out of poverty,but has also been prone to corruption. The lack of traceability and transparency has made the industry unsustainable.

author: gloiresalva
title: Vaccines and Family Medical Record
description: The problem of treatment and care taking into account hereditary factors of patients, vaccination and maternity. Reduction in infant mortality and inappropriate treatment

author: mucu
title: Cardano For Ugandan Universities
description: Blockchain projects are ideal for final year university projects, this requires an open source platform and Cardano should be our choice.

author: innocentnor
title: Opportunity Summit
description: Tertiary students in Ghana remain unware of the potential and opportunities of blockchain technology. Therefore, how can we educate and onboard them into the Cardano ecosystem?

author: raz
title: Africa Stakepool Alliance
description: Africa is the world's youngest continent with 60% of the population below 25 years old. A Stakepool Alliance supporting single SPOs in Africa to promote decentralization of the network is lacking.

author: galsen19
title: Cardanonization of town halls
description:
Administrative slowness
Ineffective.
In Africa, city administrator have great difficulty receiving or recovering their administrative documents in Théo event of an emergency or in the event of need.

author: kj2spyone
title: Cardano Academy GH
description: There is limited knowledge and information about the Cardano ecosystem,Blockchain technology, cryptocurrency (ada), smart contracts and the Metaverse among students in Basic schools in Ghana.

author: dynamicstrategiesio
title: Workshop 4-days in Angola
description: Partnerships with local businesses to sponsor education in blockchain technology, Cardano events, networking with developers and employment opportunities for participants

author: mustapha
title: Catalyst Campus Train
description: Most Colleges in Ghana neither teach the ideas of entrepreneurship nor does it provide students with the skills and opportunities they need to effectively gain financial and economic freedom.

author: dag1
title: COMPLETE African Artist On-Boarding
description: There is not a well defined process for on-boarding new African artists to Cardano, that includes proper considerations to barriers of entry into the Cardano ecosystem.

author: ebuckle
title: COP27 Elevating African Leadership
description: COP27 is not inclusive enough resulting in blind decision-making. Cardano does not have a presence at this global event and Africa is the new frontier of blockchain combined with climate solutions.

author: ebuckle
title: Mentorship moving beyond borders
description: The lack of mentorship is leaving people behind, specifically in Africa and the global South. Cardano does not have a presence as a global, crypto mentor for impact investing.

author: ebuckle
title: Investing in Africa
description: Africa and the Global South are getting smaller portions of Catalyst funding.

author: ebuckle
title: Building resilient youth
description: Youth leaders are not equipped with the tools to deal with the complexity of climate change, emerging economies, and endemic barriers.

author: raz
title: Marketing Training for African SPOs
description: It's challenging being a Stake Pool Operator (SPO) let alone the 1st SPO in a country. On top of technical skills, SPOs need entrepreneurial, marketing, and managerial skills to operate sustainably.

author: tevosaks
title: Proposal Writing Service
description: New proposers may lack the knowledge and clarity to start writing compelling proposals.

author: obiiokafor1
title: Eon Brands!
description:
Most NFT projects if we are being honest, have zero to little utility and does not represent anything other than proof of authenticity of an Image.
What if we could do it better?

author: ubiodee
title: RemoStart: Africa Job Shadowing
description: No African country has met its SDG goal for decent work and economic growth and reduced inequalities. With a teeming youth population, how can we convert her population to talents for economic growth?

author: drainslordy
title: CARDANO TO THE EYES OF AFRICA
description:
PROBLEM:
THE CARDANO TO THE EYES OF AFRICA IS NOT SEEN AS OTHER PROJECT AND AS ITS ECOSYSTEM IS NOT AS MUCH USE AROUND. THIS IS PRACTICALLY MEANS THAT DUE TO LOW EXPOSURE AND EXPERIENCE.

author: binetangom
title: TECH-E
description:
Nelson Mandela “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world”
Africa lacks skilled blockchain developers. It necessity today to train developers to meet these challenges

author: maps2go
title: TiDi Nation - Grow Africa
description: There's a lack of access to resources and education for African student athletes, artists and creatives on monetization, entrepreneurship, and ownership.

author: mavster04
title: Medical Records Ownership Protocol
description: Who owns a medical record? Who has the rights to access it? Is it the doctors, health facilities, or the patients? This has been an ongoing debate in the health sector.

author: mavster04
title: Healthcare Providers Onboarding
description: In Africa, many health facilities and providers like clinics, health centers, and doctors are still NOT using Medical Records systems that could make their operations more efficient and productive.

author: immunifylife
title: Immunify.life HIV clinical Study
description:
1.4 M with HIV
4.8% HIV prevalence
33,000 new HIV infections 
19,000 AIDs related deaths
30% of adults with HIV and 40% children, do not take the life saving medication that is available

author: defidiscussions
title: Outreach/Education Ghana
description: Interest in as well as engagement with the Cardano community and project catalyst is lacking in West Africa but specifically Ghana.

author: victorycompany243
title: My Identity
description: In DRC, more than 160,000 teachers work hard but very often are not on the list of state employees, which causes several disorders (corruption) in the Congolese education system and unbalances

author: jeffghome2020
title: CardanoOutreach - Africa Focus
description: We have difficulty reaching African Developers due to language gaps. We cannot currently meet with most African students and professors to facilitate education and oboarding to the ecosystem.

author: frank4frank007
title: Dripada: Nigeria’s Cardano Hub
description: Nigeria despite being on the top list of cryptocurrency users globally are still yet to get familiar with Cardano and it’s unique EUTXO mechanism that is supreme to other EVM based blockchains.

author: quad33kpar
title: SHiELD Dapp, growing Africa digital
description: How do we stop corruption while improving the flow of information, plus productivity of the individual, the government, and the private sector in Africa.

author: jpg.store
title: African Ambassador for CNFTs
description: NFTs on Cardano have seen an uptick in trading volume over the past few months, though as per our analytics most of our traffic tends to originate from North America.

author: salmen
title: Decentralize Impact
description: The lack of guidance, support, building and networking opportunities in the Blockchain, Web3 & Crypto communities in Tunisia. These communities are full of talented people, but they are scattered.

author: salmen
title: Cardano Students Hub
description: Lack of exposure leaves young Tunisian students and entrepreneurs not able to capitalize on their backgrounds to get introduced to Cardano.

author: gchub
title: Mining traceability in a war zone
description: The DRC has strategic mining reserves: GOLD, Coltan, cobalt, uranium whose exploitation does not benefit the population following smuggling

author: ghassann555
title: Afro-Asian youth connection
description: With the rise of blockchain and global connection, more connection is needed that connects Africa and Asia, specially through ICT & culture. Cardano could help Asian and African youth to collaborate.

author: nebiyus
title: East Africa Cardano Innovation Hub
description: The absence of a Coordination Hub and a space for Cardano enthusiasts to collaborate, it is limiting the growth of Cardano in East Africa

author: fideliaayaabilla14gmail.com2
title: Cardano Ladies Hub (CLH)
description: Women at the University of Cape Coast want to learn and contribute to the blockchain ecosystem but do not have the means to do that. The Cardano lady's Hub will offer them the environment to do that.

author: bd
title: Cardano Youth Ambassadors
description: Youth in Africa is unaware of Cardano, the blockchain, and the potential to use its application for social impact and a more decentralized future.

author: kiziltasalperensalih
title: Medium of underrepresented Africans
description: Establishing equal opportunity in reaching reliable info for the underrepresented people in Africa, which does not have a strong tech infrastructure, is crucial for the growth of Cardano and bc.

author: benjito
title: ARTS, COMICS AND NFT IN GABON
description:
Crypto and NFT are a novelty in Gabon
Artists struggle because there's no art market and no Comics industry there
The rest of the world is unaware of the richness and diversity of African cultures

author: oscarbahatimuk
title: support for education
description: Nort kivu is one of provinces of DRCongo,to the east. It has an area of 5948km2. It is made up to 6 administratives . For more than decades; this province has been the victim of several atrocities

author: gemechis
title: DegaFund crowd fundraising system
description: In the case of Ethiopia platforms have been subject to fraudulent issues with Gofundme because its accounts are not accessible to Ethiopians and the rest of Africa plus it lacks smart contracts.

author: olfayadi
title: Powerchain by Lightency
description:
1.2 billion people in the world are living off-grid
Crypto investors lack access to energy related Crypto assets
Energy consumers have a passive role and are not incentivized to produce green energy

author: bolaji
title: Ada NFT Marketplace for the unsung
description: Unsung creatives are challenged with counterfeits, inadequate artwork provenance, extended time to market and inadequate financial services.

author: reneebill
title: Supply dustbin cans in universities
description: Due to time these details will be given in the comments

author: jeremyk
title: Parcel Delivery MVP Testing
description: Postal services in African countries are expensive, unreliable, slow, inconvenient, inefficient and even inaccessible to many people according to reports of the Universal Postal Union (UPU).

author: ppdac
title: US-Kenya Based WOT Remittance Chain
description: There does not exist a trust-chain from the migrant community sending remittances to regions where sanctions and flashpoints are common, and fear of intangibility of assets are unacceptable.

author: akim94
title: The tokenization of real estate
description: Particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic, one of the problems of the real estate sector as the dependence on physical meetings to conclude contracts stands out. Procedural difficulties

author: sandralvproject
title: Cooperative dApp
description: Cooperatives and NGO's in Africa have for decades suffered from corruption and financial injustice. Only 1% of members receive the majority of the money. There is a lack of transparency and trust.

author: adenan44
title: CARDANO HUB IN CKT
description: To facilitate the pace of Blockchain utilization, there is the need to obtain access in institution of higher learning.
